message.content:
cs.NI, cs.GT, cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of joint bandwidth-relay allocation in a cooperative device-to-device (CD2D) network. CD2D communication is a subfield of networked systems and protocols, which falls under the category of computer networks (cs.NI). The paper also involves game theory, which is a subfield of theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence, falling under the category of game theory and economics (cs.GT). The paper also involves information theory (cs.IT) as it deals with the allocation of bandwidth. Additionally, the paper involves modeling and simulation (cs.SI) as it proposes a two-stage game to model the behavior of mobile devices. Finally, the paper involves multimedia (cs.MM) as it deals with the performance of the network in terms of service delay and utility.
